ISSUE.TITLE: Internal Error when code has async/await (transpiled)
ISSUE.DESCRIPTION: Seeing the following error when I have `async/await` code present, even though it's transpiled.. ``` ▲ ~/sandbox/community-group-backend now --docker --debug master :: 14h36m :: ⬡ > [debug] Checking for updates. > [debug] Up to date (0.28.1). > Deploying ~/sandbox/community-group-backend > [debug] Forcing `deploymentType` = `docker` > No `name` LABEL in `Dockerfile`, using (An unexpected internal error occurred) ``` My Dockerfile looks like so: ```Dockerfile FROM node:6.9 ENV PORT 80 RUN mkdir -p /usr/src/app COPY package.json /usr/src/app/ RUN npm install --production COPY . /usr/src/app WORKDIR /usr/src/app EXPOSE 80 CMD [ "npm", "start" ] ```

BUGGYCOMMIT.MESSAGE: tests: print headers in deploymentPost too

COMMIT.MESSAGE: [now-bash] Rename `serve` function to `handler` (#125) This is more consistent with what you would expect for a lambda function, and we should maintain that convention. For example: https://github.com/gkrizek/bash-lambda-layer
